get.description: Retrieve information about cards associated with a specific account. Note that status and physical card status are two separate concepts. Either one being set to something other than "active" could cause a transaction to be declined. For example, your credit card could be active overall (status = "active"), but locked to prevent in-person usage of the physical card itself (physicalCardStatus = "locked"). Alternatively, your credit card could have no restrictions on the use of the physical card itself (physicalCardStatus = "active") but the overall card could be frozen (status = "frozen") to decline all authorizations, no matter the circumstance.

checkInfo.description: Information needed to send a physical check.

address.description: Mailing address for sending a physical check.

region.description: Either a two-letter US state code like "CA" for California or a free-form identification of a particular region worldwide

electronicRoutingInfo.description: Information needed to send an ACH. Note that all fields in this object are required.

address.description: This has to be the recipient's *legal address*.

region.description: Either a two-letter US state code like "CA" for California or a free-form identification of a particular region worldwide

domesticWireRoutingInfo.description: Information needed to send a domestic wire. Note that all fields in this object are required.

internationalWireRoutingInfo.description: Information needed to send an international wire. Note that iban, swiftCode, and address are always required, whereas country-specific fields are only required if the recipient resides in that country.

region.description: Either a two-letter US state code like "CA" for California or a free-form identification of a particular region worldwide

get.description: Retrieve information about your transactions for a specific account

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit how many transactions you want to retrieve.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The number of most recent transactions you want to omit.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Earliest createdAt date to filter for. If it's not provided, it defaults to 30 days ago. Format: YYYY-MM-DD or an ISO 8601 string. Please note that your Mercury transactions on your Dashboard might have their postedAt date displayed, as opposed to createdAt

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: Latest createdAt date to filter for. If it's not provided, it defaults to current day. Format: YYYY-MM-DD or an ISO 8601 string. Please note that your Mercury transactions on your Dashboard might have their postedAt date displayed, as opposed to createdAt

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search term to look for in transaction descriptions.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Optional sort order for the transactions based on the createdAt date.

get.description: Retrieve statement information for a depository account in a given time period (Note: For now, treasury and credit accounts are not supported on this endpoint. You may request this functionality by reaching out to support.)

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Filter the statements so that their startDate is equal to or later than this date. Format: YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: Filter the statements so that their endDate is less than or equal to this date. Format: YYYY-MM-DD.

message.example: Date range must not exceed 3 months.
